Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured and white-ground pottery kylix; interior: lip black with red-figure decoration consisting of wreath to left, berries in added white with yellow and probably dilute brown, stems of berries in faded colour; wall white ground; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of a woman (head and right arm remaining) looking to left, wearing wreath with reserved leaves, probably an earring and sleeved chiton; to left, outline band of further figure.
Curator's comments: See also Wehgartner, I., Attisch weissgrundige Keramik. Maltechniken, Werkstätten, Formen, Verwendung. Mainz 1983, 69, no. 72, 94; Mertens, J. R., Attic White-Ground. Its Development on Shapes Other Than Lekythoi. New York and London 1977, 173, no. 48, 178.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 518, no. C99)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0666) (Phase 1)
